item.title: Physical Sovereignty Crisis: Back Pain Flare & Response
item.description:
Physical Sovereignty Crisis: Back Pain Flare & Response

Summary: Acute back pain flare: care-provider recon showed systemic delays. Decision: book future specialist slot, deploy immediate countermeasures, pivot to root cause via mattress procurement.

Source: Raw Transcripts TXT: Batch 2

Notes

  • Keep this as a “card” unless you’re expanding with raw excerpts.
  • When expanding, add 1–3 concrete examples and link back to the relevant protocol.

item.title: Real-World Connection Protocol (RCP)
item.description:
Real-World Connection Protocol (RCP)

Summary: Governance filter: ‘Does this build a bridge to Relational or Financial/Professional Sovereignty?’ If not, log as substitution and redirect.

Source: Raw Transcripts TXT: Batches 1–5

Notes

item.title: Relational Sovereignty: Parallel Track Declaration
item.description:
Relational Sovereignty: Parallel Track Declaration

Summary: Relational Sovereignty declared a pillar equal to financial/professional goals. Authentic connection framed as sovereign priority, not side quest.

Source: Raw Transcripts TXT: Batch 4

item.title: Sovereignty Definition: Financial, Professional, Relational
item.description:
Sovereignty Definition: Financial, Professional, Relational

Summary: Three pillars used as decision criteria: Financial/Professional Sovereignty and Relational Sovereignty (with enjoyment as an outcome metric).

Source: Raw Transcripts TXT: Batches 1–4
